entries.content: Do not automatically agree to send information when a prospect asks; always qualify first.
When a prospect asks for information, ask clarifying questions to understand their specific interest or need.
What information specifically would you be hoping to see?
Could I ask what it is specifically that's piqued your interest?
Rather than blast you with absolutely everything...
entries.notes: Use as a transition to explain why sending general info isn't ideal.

entries.content: It doesn't make sense for me to just send you information without knowing what's most relevant to you.
Suggest a brief follow-up call as an alternative to sending a large, untargeted amount of information.
Would you be open to a super quick call later today or tomorrow where I can make sure what I send is specific to your needs?
